title.narrative: Provision of HIV Prevention, Care, and Treatment for Prisoners and Non-Military Uniformed Service Members

description.narrative:
- Ensure program sustainability through support of decision/policy makers of the non-military uniformed services in the HIV/AIDS prevention programs
- Expand provision of comprehensive HIV prevention, care and treatment services to the target population
- Build the capacity of AIDS Control Units within the uniformed services to manage HIV prevention, care and treatment services as well as administrative and financial management of funds
- Develop relevant HIV policies for Kenya non-military uniformed services in collaboration with other key stakeholders
- Support and strengthen procurement systems and distribution of program supplies and commodities in order to ensure continuous provision of services
- Provide support for cascading of various activities of AIDS Control Units of the Kenya non-military uniformed services

International Medical Corps, through a cooperative agreement with the Center for Disease Control and Prevention, continues to implement a program that provides technical assistance, financial support and capacity building for HIV prevention, care and treatment for Kenya Prisons Services (KPS). The overall goal is to reduce the spread of HIV, improve the quality of life of those infected and affected, and mitigate the socio-economic impact of the epidemic among inmates/prisoners, KPS officers, families, and neighboring communities in Kenya. International Medical Corps is the lead implementing partner with one sub-grantee, Catholic Relief Services (CRS). CRS is responsible for capacity building activities.
